persons

Interface IPersonDB

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PersonDBStub

    public interface IPersonDB
    An interface for databases of persons. The interface essentially declares CRUD operations, and operations to add/check passwords (while these are not stored in class Person). The key for distinguishing two persons from each other is assumed to be the email address.
    Since:
    February, 2013
    Author:
    Charlotte Lecluze and Bruno Zanuttini, Université de Caen Basse-Normandie, France

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void create(Person p, java.lang.String password)
      Adds a person to this database.
      void delete(java.lang.String email)
      Removes the person with a given email address from this database.
      boolean exists(java.lang.String email)
      Decides whether a person with a given email exists in the list.
      boolean isValid(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      Decides whether a given couple (email,password) exists in the list.
      Person retrieve(java.lang.String email)
      Returns the person with a given email (i.e., primary key).
      java.util.Collection<Person> retrieveAll()
      Returns the list of all persons in this databse.
      java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> retrieveAllEmails()
      Returns the list of all email addresses (i.e., primary keys) in this database.
      void update(java.lang.String email, Person person)
      Updates the person associated to a given email address in the database.
      void updatePassword(java.lang.String email, java.lang.String password)
      Updates a person's password in the database.

    • Method Detail

      • create

        void create(Person p,
            java.lang.String password)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        Adds a person to this database.
        Parameters:
        p - The person to add
        password - The password for p
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a person with the same email address already exists in the list or a database access error occurs

      • retrieveAll

        java.util.Collection<Person> retrieveAll()
                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the list of all persons in this databse.
        Returns:
        The list of all persons in this databse as an instance of java.util.CollectionPerson.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a database access error occurs

      • retrieveAllEmails

        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> retrieveAllEmails()
                                                  throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the list of all email addresses (i.e., primary keys) in this database.
        Returns:
        The list of all logins in this database as an instance of java.util.CollectionString.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a database access error occurs

      • retrieve

        Person retrieve(java.lang.String email)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Returns the person with a given email (i.e., primary key).
        Parameters:
        email - The email to search for
        Returns:
        The person with the given email in the list
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if no person with the given email exists in the list or a database access error occurs

      • isValid

        boolean isValid(java.lang.String email,
                java.lang.String password)
         throws java.lang.Exception
        Decides whether a given couple (email,password) exists in the list.
        Returns:
        false if either there is no person with the given email in the list or the password is incorrect, true otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a database access error occurs

      • exists

        boolean exists(java.lang.String email)
        throws java.lang.Exception
        Decides whether a person with a given email exists in the list.
        Returns:
        true is the list contains a person with the given email, false otherwise
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if a database access error occurs

      • update

        void update(java.lang.String email,
            Person person)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates the person associated to a given email address in the database. Given that the email address is part of an instance of Person, this method may be safely used to change the email address itself.
        Parameters:
        email - The email address of the person to update
        person - An instance of Person to store in place of the existing one
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if no person is currently associated to the given email address, or the new instance has an email address which already exists in the database, or a database access error occurs

      • updatePassword

        void updatePassword(java.lang.String email,
                    java.lang.String password)
             throws java.lang.Exception
        Updates a person's password in the database.
        Parameters:
        email - The email address of the person whose password to update
        password - The new password for the person
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if no person is currently associated to the given email address or a database access error occurs

      • delete

        void delete(java.lang.String email)
     throws java.lang.Exception
        Removes the person with a given email address from this database.
        Parameters:
        email - The email address of the person to remove
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if no person is currently associated to the given email address or a database access error occurs
